bibl.title: Petitioner v. Defendant.
bibl.note: Our transcription is based on a digital image of the microfilmed original.

div1.p: Court met at 10 o'clock A.M. and was called to order pursuant to adjournment; present the same Judge and other officers as on the preceeding day.
The following proceedings were had to-wit: Nettie A. Schlador, Plaintiff, -vs- #7926. Lena Schlador, Calvin Schlador, Alta Schlador, Archibald Schlador and John Wolford, Defendants.

Now on this 24th day of March 1903 this cause coming on to be heard on plaintiffs motion for an order appointing F.W.Waters as Guardian ad litem for Caroline Schlader, Alta Schlader and Archibald Schalder, minor children, and it appearing to the Court and the court finds that such minor children, the defendants above named, have been duly and regularly served with Summons herein as required by law and that have made no application for the appointment for a guardian at litem for them, and the time for making such application has expired and that said F, W. Water is a fit and suitable person to be appointed as such guardian ad litem.
